comment: This class was the worst, and if a 0 rating counted on this site I'd still try to give her a -5. She's a horrible professor. The ENTIRE SEMESTER was presentations, only presentations, and she barely taught. I can't remember a single lecture she actually did. And her grading is horrific, she's unclear and inconsistent. If she likes you, you pass!
Loved her. A bit confusing with her grading but shes a good teacher.

She's a great professor all around. She tries to establish a chill atmosphere in her classroom where everyone is comfortable with each other. She doesn't really put up with laziness, but that should be expected on the college level. Her assignments and classes are interesting and engaging and she makes it very clear what to do to get a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class wasnt impossible. I got an A, but I didnt think I would just did good on final. Shes kind of rude sometimes, but most of the time shes cool. I tried to talk to her about fixing my group project grades and she didnt seem to care. You dont do much but there is so little grades they count a lot. Just try and you wont fail.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: She really cares about all her students she want you to succeed. But she doesn't put up with slack. She knows if you try or not. She is the sweetest and is a real gem. She really cares about what she teaches.
Very nice and helpful professor! Class is challenging and you should expect a lot of group work, but as long as you show up to class and do your part you should be fine!

Big group project due at the end of the semester. Gives lengthy, pointless homework assignments. She is very laid back, young and energetic. Very funny at times but likes to get down to business when necessary. Very helpful when needed, but has no mercy while grading. Tests are relatively easy, i recommend another teacher for seminar.

She is pretty funny and makes class entertaining and interesting, however her grading criteria for the group project stuff is ridiculously strict and she gives seemingly pointless homework assignments when you should be learning to keep up with reading and stuff on your own as a college student. would not take again

I absolutely loved this teacher, she was  helpful and truly cares for her students. She pushes you to do your best, and if you show her committment she will help you be successful! If you take her class be ready to work, because she definitely challenges you and expects college level work. Those who complain about her just didn't do the work.

I loved Professor Nguyens class! She is fun and energetic with her lectures and always had our class laughing. As long as you read the chapters she assigns and choose good partners for the group project, then you should make a good grade! Oh, and always be super specific with your answers to her questions. Overall fun class!

Dr. Nguyen is vague in class and her tests are ridiculously specific and impossible to do well on. I was in the Honors class her first semester teaching at KSU. Our old professor left a few weeks before classes started so we had a course change AND professor change. She was awful. Only 1 HONORS student made an A. Do not take! You'll regret it.

The class is hard- you have to REALLY read both books. She's young so she's really energetic, and uses terminology probably intended for grad students. Good personality and will help if you ask. Long annotated bibliography that everyone pretty much failed. Also a semester long video project. Good luck

Reading the two textbooks is critical in passing this class. All test questions will be based on specific quotes and stats from both books, not concepts. Assigned a group project due at the end of the semester, with majority of your grade coming from it. So be sure to choose good partners. Included 20 page bibliography and video.

I had Professor Nguyen for the Honors KSU 1111 class. This class is absolutely horrible. She never gives you specifics on projects and then asks why you didn't put x y and z in it. The tests are super specific and absolutely hard to make an A on. There is a 20 source bibliography you have to do with group members and no one made an A. DONT TAKE!!!!
